On Jan 27, 2012, at 0:38, "Jorn Wildt" <jw@...> wrote:
> At com=
pile-time (or "read the documentation time") the inputs are useful for tell=
ing my program (the developer) which values to that corresponds to what. As=
 the developer I can see that the name of the person must be sent as "Perso=
nName=3Dxxx". But after this I don't see how the client program can use the=
 input definitions for anything at runtime.

value ranges, default values, =
and hidden/disabled controls, all of them based on the context of the reque=
st. if you do this right, clients have to deal with a smaller set of option=
s and have to make only the decisions that actually matter for their contex=
t.

cheers,

dret.
